questions.question: Which of the following are valid reasons to learn Python? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It can only be used for web development
It's used in data science and machine learning
It has a large community and many libraries

questions.explanation: Python is popular because of its readable syntax, versatility across many domains (web, data science, ML, automation), and its large ecosystem of libraries. It's interpreted, not compiled.

questions.question: What does the print() function do in Python?
questions.explanation: The print() function displays text output to the screen/console/terminal. It doesn't create variables or send anything to a physical printer.

questions.question: Arrange the steps to run your first Python program in the correct order:

items.text: Download and install Python from python.org
Write your Python code in the file

questions.explanation: First install Python, verify it works, then create a .py file, write your code, and finally run it from the terminal.

questions.question: What is the REPL in Python?

options.text: A way to run code line by line

questions.explanation: REPL stands for Read-Eval-Print Loop. It's an interactive shell where you can run Python code line by line and see immediate results.

questions.question: Which command correctly runs a Python file named 'hello.py'?
questions.explanation: You run Python files using either 'python filename.py' or 'python3 filename.py' depending on your system configuration.
